doc: The pathname to the SDF file containing the chemical system to work with.

Lines defining the quantities to measure. Each line must adhere to the following syntax: <String> <String> [<String> [<String>]] where each string is a SMARTS query identifying atoms used to calculate values. The number of SMARTS defines the type of quantity measured: two for a distance, three for an angle, and four for an dihedral angle.

Lines defining the quantities to measure. Each line must adhere to the following syntax: <int> <int> [<int> [<int>]] where each string is a SMARTS query identifying atoms used to calculate values. The number of SMARTS defines the type of quantity measured: two for a distance, three for an angle, and four for an dihedral angle.

If the value is 'True', only the tuples corresponding to chains of bonded atoms will be considered as measurable quantities. For example, is 3 SMARTS are given, we'll measure only the angles that correspond to triplets of atoms A-B-C where A and B are bonded and B and C are bonded.
Sets the amount of log messages. Values larger than 0 will make the worker write more and more detailed log reports.
